chapter.title: About Media Encoding Cluster
chapter.para: The Media Encoding CLuster is a Programm which can be used to Encode Media Files Distributed over Nodes that reduces the Encoding Time.

section.title: Why using Media Encoding Cluster
section.para: If you want to reduce Encoding Time per Media File!
If you want to Encode Files in a Batch!
If you want to have a Fault tollerant and allmost uptime Infrastructure for your Media Services!

section.title: Which Operting System for using Media Encoding Cluster
section.para: It is currently running under Windows XP, Linux, MacOsx 10.5

section.title: What do i need for running the Media Encoding Cluster
section.para: You need only the Download Package from http://codergrid.de

section.title: Installation on Windows XP
section.para: Download the Programm from http://sourceforge.net/
Double Click on "MediaEncodingCluster-Setup-X.X.X.X.exe", where "X.X.X.X" is the actual Version.
This will open the Welcome Screen from the Installer.

caption.para: After "next" Button clicked, you can enter the Target Diretory location for the Programm Installation.
Accept the default installation location or enter a new location.
Note, there must be enough Space Left for Temporary Encoded Data and the Encoded Files
Default Programm Group where the Tools are located in the Windows Programm Menu
Accept the default location for the Media Encoding Cluster program shortcuts or enter a new location.

listitem.para: Server System
System will be configured to autostart the Server as System Service
Client System
System will be configured to autostart the Client as System Service

caption.para: Review your installation choices. Click Back to make any necessary changes.
Note: On Windows, Microsoft Visual C++ 2008 Redistributable Package also installs.
you can start the Runtime System on the Node
Select any final options and click Finish. The installation is complete. If you configured it to start, Media Encoding Cluster starts.

section.para: After installation there is an new Service under the Windows Services called MHiveService
This Service will be automatically started when the System boots up.
Setup finish!

section.title: Configure the System
section.para: the configuration is started, when you access the admin page the first time, you will be guided through the configuration steps. The Configuration will setup internal database and write the essential config Files.

chapter.title: Starting and Stopping the System
chapter.para: In condition to your Configuration, the Server and/or the Client starts automatical on the Node.

section.title: Start and Stop the Server on Windows
Start the Server from the Start menu

listitem.para: Choose Start -> All Programs -> MediaEncodingCluster -> Server -> start Server

section.title: Stop the Server from the Start menu

listitem.para: Choose Start -> All Programs -> MediaEncodingCluster -> Server -> stop Server

section.title: Start, stop or restart the Server from the Services window

listitem.para: Choose Start -> Control Panel -> Administrative Tools -> Services
Select MediaEncodingService from the Services list and click Stop, Start or Restart.

section.title: Start and stop the server on Linux
section.para: On Linux, Media Encoding Cluster is installed as a service. You start and stop the Media Encoding Cluster service using the mhive binary itself. Use the mhive utility to perform other tasks as well, such as start automatically when the system is started.

section.title: Start, stop, or restart Media Encoding CLuster

listitem.para: Log in as a root user.
Open a shell window, change to the directory where the server is installed and type one of the following: ./bin/mhive start|stop.
Create a Profile like the existing "test" Profile, please be carefull when entering data, wrong data may crash the server and the client
Create a Watchfolder, selecting a Directory from which the Files come to Encode, select a Directory to write the Encoded Files to and select a Profile in which the Source Files will be Encoded to.
thats all, every 10 sec. the Watchfolder will searched for new Files, new Files will be visible in the Files Section under Imported Files.
under the Encodings Menu you can see the Encoding Processes and in which state there are

section.title: Main Concept of the Media Encoding Cluster
section.para: The Media Encoding CLuster is mainly used to Transcode multiple Media Files from one Format into an other Format, these formats will be described by a Profile. To Transcode one File into an other Format, it will be performed over some Watchfolder, watchfolders will be permanently scanned and new Files found in these folders will be imported into the Cluster, these watchfolder can be connected to a Profile, a Profile is mainly the Target Format in which these files will be encoded to. The Watchfolder have a parameter called Output Folder, these folder will be used to write the successfull encoded Files into.
Currently there is no stable Release out from the Media Encoding Cluster.
All Input made by the Users will not Checked and can cause a crash of the Software

section.para: in the base installation dirextory there is a dmp directory, in that there are .dmp files that can be uploaded to us.
